byline.original: By GEETA ANAND and DHARISHA BASTIANS

abstract: Sri Lankans see unique opportunity, following 2015 election of Pres Maithripala Sirisena by broad and diverse political coalition, to heal country after decades of ethnic and sectarian strife; some question whether mild-mannered leader can deliver on his promise to rewrite Constitution and devolve power, despite early successes.

headline.print_headline: An Unlikely Sri Lankan Leader, and a Chance at Peace
headline.main: Can a New President Lead Sri Lanka Into an Era of Peace?

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

snippet: President Maithripala Sirisena, chosen by a coalition because he was agreeable and self-effacing, is trying to forge a political solution that for decades has been out of reach.
lead_paragraph: President Maithripala Sirisena, chosen by a coalition because he was agreeable and self-effacing, is trying to forge a political solution that for decades has been out of reach.
